title: SMC_GroupSetLoad (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_GroupSetLoad
This function block allows to set a
Load
, consisting of mass and inertia,
that is connected to the TCP of the axis group.  The load could be a tool
that is attached to the flange or an object that has been picked up by
the machine.
A dynamic model for the machine must have been configured before using
this function block. See
SMC_GroupSetDynamics
.
Note
A new
Load
replaces a previously set load.
An object that is picked up by a tool can be modeled by combining
the load for the object and the load for the tool.
The load is always represented in the current TCS, relative to the
current TCP.  Note that setting a tool using
SMC_GroupSetTool
changes the TCP and the TCS.  This means in particular that the
representation for the load for a tool is different depending on
whether the load is set before or after the tool.

rows.Name: AxisGroup
rows.Comment: Reference to a group of axes

rows.Name: Execute
rows.Comment: Executes the FB at the rising edge.

rows: The load to be set, represented in the TCS.
Specifies when the load should be adopted.

rows.Name: Done
rows.Comment: The defined load has been added to the axisgroup

rows: Signals that an error has occurred within the function block
